tutorial: 3. Testing a Trading Idea - The Trigger Stage

definition.text: I mentioned we would use the previous property to modify each property on both sides of the statement...

paragraphs.text: I just wanted to clarify that such use is not mandatory! You may use the previous property on the statements of your choice. In our case, we need to compare the close of the candle, with the difference of the moving average and the deviation of the same candle! That is why we apply it to all statements!

But you may, for instance, want to compare the close of the current candle to the close of the previous candle! In such a case, you may build a statement as follows:

chart.at01hs.candle.close > chart.at01hs.candle.previous.close
